btw, when new comments come in you could update the existing PR instead of closing and making a new one. It makes it easier to track the history of the discussion and the evolution of the patch.
got it - i usually close and reopen to prevent merges taking place, but i'll keep open going forward, thanks.

@maosongfu  , @billonahill  - with respect to this issue - need your advice on choosing between the two options:

option 1:  organize the workspace in the following way:  in this approach, we define the module at HERON_ROOT, and we define 3 content roots:
1. Heron root itself
2. Heron Java (heron/heron)
3. Heron 3rd party

the benefits are that you dont have to whitelist every folder and file under heron root
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4031715/14623252/4db64fa8-0585-11e6-9b1c-edbcb03f43f6.png)

pro's , all files under heron workspace is managed and no out of band process required for top level additions
cons : the file naming structure is not logical today.. heron root is named heron. heron java is named heron, resulting in a lot of confusion 

Option 2:
explicitly include every folder under heron root as a content root. the benefit is a more natural organization, where everything appears to be logically below the heron root . however , in order to do this , every folder needs to be explicitly listed as a content root in the IML., which means addition of a new folder at the top level requires a run of setup intellij. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4031715/14623429/f4c06e0e-0586-11e6-8bc4-5e93330c1a40.png)

not sure if I articulated this well - so please let know if the options are clear . if they are , please advice.

Thanks
prabhu

Done in PR #368

Thanks @prabhuinbarajan, option 2 seems better to me. Bonus if we can edit the top level files like bazel_configure.py and have the be recognized project filed. I think that might make the top level the root though.

Having to re-build the idea project upon new folders isn't a big deal, but we should make it as easy as possible. Like you should be able to re-run the script and it wipes out the old idea project files and builds a new one. One command to basically refresh the project.

I took the required version from the compile.md documentation. Should we be upgrading automake on the internal hosts, or downgrading the required version? @kramasamy do you know why is 1.11.1 required?
In what OS are you seeing this?
I took the required version from the compile.md documentation. Should we be upgrading python on the internal hosts, or downgrading the required version? @kramasamy do you know why is 2.7 required?

Actually, the python env checking is kinda suspect. I'm not sure why we do it, since nothing from the script execution persists to the running of bazel. For example, I have to do the following on a mac:

```
PYTHON2=/usr/bin/python2.7 ./bazel_configure.py
```

which makes the check script happy. But I then run bazel, which I suspect gets whatever python is in my environment (by luck it happens to also be python 2.7.10:

```
$ python --version
Python 2.7.10
$ which python2
[nothing]
```

@billonahill - I recommended version based on some of compiling in our nest machines and mac machines. I took the minimum and recommended it. Now it looks like jenkin machines have only 1.9.6. Since it seems to be work, we should lower our version to 1.9.6?

this is what centos5 machines report

```
cmake --version
cmake version 2.6-patch 4
```

very differently.

I like @nlu90's approach more than just relying on the configure_bazel.sh approach, although if we're going to tell users to run configure_bazel.sh to verify the env in advance, we should check for pyhton2.7 if that's what the scripts will require.
Yes, let's lower it.
@lucperkins let me know when you're ready for a review.

Docker's centos reports 2.8.11:
https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/306#issuecomment-208559907

I think the correct fix would be to replace the '-patch ' with a dot when building the semver, so it's valid.
thanks for the suggestion.
@billonahill It's ready for review!

in fact when i looked at tools/bazel.rc - we already force python to be python2.7 - which means bazel seems to be correctly using python2.7. bazel_configure.py needs to just verify whether python2.7 is present in the path.
probably a combination of @nlu90 approach with #!/usr/bin/env python2.7 - should ensure then we use python2.7 uniformly.
üëç
@lucperkins please see my comment above re make setup.

To just verify that python2.7 is set we can just do the command @nlu90 initially proposed above, but without the '2.7' optional variable at the end:

```
env_map['PYTHON2'] = discover_tool('python2.7', 'Python2', 'PYTHON2')
```
üëç

@prabhuinbarajan in PR #404 I'm adding support for checkstyles and copyright headers, which we should also include in the IntelliJ setup.

For the styles you can follow the instructions in https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/404/files#diff-e3ab259ab2bf07b0feecc1e8eda32bec to include `tools/java/src/com/twitter/bazel/checkstyle/HeronIDEA.xml` in the project and see how that should appear in the generated project files. 

For the latter we should be able to just include the following files, which I've included below:

```
.idea/copyright/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Heron.xml
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ profiles_settings.xml
```

`Heron.xml`:

```
<component name="CopyrightManager">
  <copyright>
    <option name="myName" value="Heron" />
    <option name="notice" value="// Copyright &#36;today.year Twitter. All rights reserved.
//
// Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
// you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
// You may obtain a copy of the License at
//
//    http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
//
// Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
// distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
// WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
// See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
// limitations under the License." />
  </copyright>
</component>
```

`profile_settings.xml`:

```
<component name="CopyrightManager">
  <settings default="Heron">
    <module2copyright>
      <element module="All" copyright="Heron" />
    </module2copyright>
  </settings>
</component>
```

Bill, sounds good, i will include them

Fixing the styles in #410. Closing this and will resubmit.

@billonahill - per last comment, since make terminates if error is reached unless suppressed (which sets error code to "success"), the only workaround i could find is to run linkchecker twice.  first run, error code is suppressed, error output is formatted.  second runs without error code suppressed -> on fail, linkchecker fails.  on success, linkchecker removes formatted error output (which is empty) and continues.  not ideal, but any other suggestions would be helpful!  thanks.

Commands look incorrect, where are they located?  In "http://localhost:1313/heron/docs/developers/compiling/compiling/"  I only see the correct:

```
 $bazel build --config=darwin heron/...
```

and building all components:

```
$ bazel build --config=darwin scripts/packages:binpkgs
$ bazel build --config=darwin scripts/packages:tarpkgs
```

and building specific components:

```
$ bazel build --config=darwin heron/tracker/src/python:heron-tracker
```

travis-ci modification could still check these commands if not already.
üëç
@billonahill My bad. I thought you meant that `make assets` and `gulp build` were redundant. Now there's a strict separation between `make setup` and `make pages` et al.
The initial command I mentioned above is now working for me so closing. We're all good.
Thanks @lucperkins!
üëç

@lewiskan makes sense. I think there's enough logic happening that we should add a `linkchecker.sh` script to handle this logic, which make calls. That will simplify things, because it can fail and generate output and then return 1.
@billonahill cool, linkchecker.sh and MakeFile modifications added for review.

There are a couple of ways this patch can be tested. Following are the steps to test using light weight `MiniYarnCluster`
1. Start yarn on default port: `$ bin/hadoop jar ./share/hadoop/mapreduce/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient-2.7.2-tests.jar minicluster -rmport 8032`
2. Copy hadoop client jars in .heron/lib/scheduler (this is a temp step till user classpath is supported): `commons-collections-3.2.2.jar commons-configuration-1.6.jar commons-logging-1.1.3.jar hadoop-auth-2.7.2.jar hadoop-yarn-client-2.7.2.jar hadoop-yarn-common-2.7.2.jar htrace-core-3.1.0-incubating.jar .   commons-compress-1.4.1.jar avro-1.7.4.jar commons-lang-2.6.jar commons-lang3-3.4.jar hadoop-yarn-api-2.7.2.jar hadoop-common-2.7.2.jar netty-all-4.0.23.Final.jar jackson-mapper-asl-1.9.13.jar jackson-   core-asl-1.9.13.jar`
3. Submit topology: `$ heron submit reef ~/.heron/examples/heron-examples.jar com.twitter.heron.examples.AckingTopology AckingTopology`
4. Check yarn ui and processes: `http://localhost:8088/node`
5. For worker HA, atleast a single node pseudo cluster is needed.

Darin - REEF essentially provides an abstraction layer and allows it to run
both on in YARN and Mesos.  We will test and give some feedback.

Add BufferPoolMXBean related metrics similarly as other JVM metrics and it will work..

@billonahill  - after some research , i think it would be best to generate a copy of checkstyle file under scripts/resources/idea/codeStyleSettings.xml

it has the same format except that it has wrapper project/component elements. this will avoid extra steps in setting up the checkstyle and comes enabled when setup intellij is run. checkout the attached.
[codeStyleSettings.txt](https://github.com/twitter/heron/files/232527/codeStyleSettings.txt)

I have added the support for this in my branch, but my pull request seems to be going towards #442 . once that is merged, i should be able to submit this.

please checkout my branch
https://github.com/twitter/heron/compare/master...prabhuinbarajan:prabhu/intellij-v2?expand=1

At that point I suspect `tools/java/src/com/twitter/bazel/checkstyle/README.md` will no longer be relevant/necessary so please update or delete.
@billonahill  - I imported HeronIDEA.xml into scripts/resources/idea/codeStyleSettings.xml once (the format is slightly different and hence cant move). I will delete checkstyle/README.md.
